content.question: A current <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is established in a long, straight wire. A thin, square conductive loop is placed next to the wire, as shown. Which of the following statements best describes a change that could be made to the system to induce a clockwise current in the loop and provides a correct justification?

choices.label: Decrease the magnitude of current <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to increase the decreasing flux.

Increase the magnitude of current <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to decrease the increasing flux.
Move the loop closer to the wire. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to decrease the increasing flux.
Move the loop parallel to the wire. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to increase the decreasing flux.

content.answer: Decrease the magnitude of current <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. This will induce a clockwise current in an attempt to increase the decreasing flux.
